definition: special duty/assigned full time to a task
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

sentences.english: Objective To allocate a full-time toll collector in each medical unit and resolve the disputes due to medical charge.
sentences.chinese: 目的通過設立病區專職收費員，解決收費矛盾。

sentences.english: In Chinese Mythology, Laojun was in charge of alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 在中國神話裏，太上老君專職修煉仙丹。

sentences.english: The OCOG may establish a functional area dealing with Transport aspects.
sentences.chinese: 組委會可以建立專職部門處理有關交通方面的事務。

sentences.english: Do you do a second job in addition to your full-time job？
sentences.chinese: 除了專職工作以外，你有沒有從事第二職業？

sentences.english: Kitchens will be staffed by a base of full-time chefs together with a stream of trainee chefs on work experience.
sentences.chinese: 廚房將配備專職廚師，還有一些實習生。

sentences.english: We had a number of workstations and full-time staff to manually perform the exports.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一些工作站和專職人員來手動地執行導出。

sentences.english: But we didn't want to just make every class-specific quest give a player a new ability.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們不希望把每個專職任務的回報都是一個能力。

sentences.english: I have been a full-timer for two years.
sentences.chinese: 我成爲黨的專職人員已經兩年了。

sentences.english: Ideally, a dedicated, impartial staff member should address these complaints.
sentences.chinese: 最好能設置一位公正的專職人員來處理這些投訴。

sentences.english: From the U. S. Preventive Services Task Force, Rockville, Maryland.
sentences.chinese: 來自美國預防服務專職小組，羅克韋爾市，馬里蘭州。

sentences.english: Next week, I get a chauffeur-driven car to impress the clients.
sentences.chinese: 下週，我會有專職司機駕駛的汽車以打動客戶。

sentences.english: The Butler will then one by one deliver the laundered items to the Guest Room.
sentences.chinese: 專職管家要一樣樣的把洗好的衣物送返客房。

sentences.english: After Changzhou fire prevention crew west end fire prevention specialty team answers alarm, rushes to the scene rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 常州市消防支隊城西消防專職隊接警後迅速趕到現場。

sentences.english: Apparently neither can the professional politicos and political observers.
sentences.chinese: 專職政治人物和政治觀察人士顯然也離不開民調。

sentences.english: The highest and the autumn people will become a full-time cartoonist, started the comic strip?
sentences.chinese: 最高和秋人能成爲專職漫畫家，開始連載漫畫嗎？

sentences.english: Working with an Internet-savvy career company can help.
sentences.chinese: 和一家互聯網專職公司合作對此很有幫助。

definition: to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
the head of an institution whose name ends in 院[yuan4]/chair of a board/president of a university/department head/dean/premier of the Republic of China/CL:個|个[ge4]
